titleStmt.title: István Dobó to Miklós Oláh (Eger, 12 June 1552)

seriesStmt.title: Bibliotheca Scriptorum Medii Recentisque Aevorum: Series nova

div.head: István Dobó to Miklós Oláh (Eger, 12 June 1552)

body.p: 1. He has reported to Oláh about what they have heard from the Turkish prisoner both via mail and through Gergely Horváth. The Pasha of Buda returned after he occupied Veszprém, now he is waiting at the field of Rákos to see Kara Ahmed Pasha’s movements before deciding about besieging the castle of Eger. He is rumoured to be building a bridge, and István Losonczy has gone there to fight him. Since Oláh knows well how many men are available to defend the castle, Dobó asks him to send reinforcements. 2. Furthermore, he should instruct Gáspár Pető, István Zolthay, and Márton Káldy to save themselves for defending the castle, and he should instruct the leaders of the county to defend the castle. 3. He is doing what he can, if anything bad still happens, it will not be his fault but due to the fact that there are too few people. He wants to increase the number of infantrymen to 300. He should give a new horse to the young man who is handing this over if his own horse is dead, in order to make sure he can return to him with the news more quickly.

div.p: Reverendissime Domine, Domine mihi semper Gratiosissime, servitiorum meorum debitam perpetuamque exhibitionem!On this letter, see Szántó 1972; and Szántó 1977.

[1.] Negotia Turcarum quomodo hic agantur et quo mihi sunt per Turcum captivum relata, Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae antea quoque et per postamSee Ep. 816./o:olahus.tei.15520607_1 et per servitorem Dominationis Vestrae Reverendissimae egregium Gregorium HorwathGergely Horváth (†1552) was cavalryan captain and Dobó’s messenger, see Sugár 1969, 221; and Csiffáry 2003, 292. perscripsi. Qualiterque Budensis bassaHadim Ali Pasha. expugnato VesprimioVeszprém. reversus sit, credo Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae apertius quam mihi constare. Nunc est in castris in campo Rakos certoque mihi nuntiatum est, exspectare dicitur motum Ahmath bassaeKara Ahmed Pasha. et ubi motum illius intelligeret, habere intentionem arcem hanc Dominationis Vestrae Reverendissimae obsidere. Ille vero pontem iam struit super Danubium et dicitur se movisse, contra quem dicitur magnificus dominus Stephanus de LossonczIstván Losonczy. etc., si quid proficere posset, profectus esse. Quare cum Dominatio Vestra Reverendissima aperte intelligit, ego quo numero gentium ad conservationem huius arcis hic sim, regia quoque maiestas quantam copiam equitum et peditum ad defensionem eiusdem arcis hic teneat, supplico Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae tamquam Domino Gratiosissimo, dignetur eadem Dominatio Vestra Reverendissima de opportuno subsidio quantum ad gentium copiam necesse est, eo modo mature providere, ne in tam amplissima arce prae paucitate gentium inopinate subruamur et (quod Deus avertat) tempore Dominationis Vestrae Reverendissimae per Turcam capiatur.

[2.] Praeterea dignetur Dominatio Vestra Reverendissima dominis Gaspar Pethew,Gáspár Pető (†after 1561) was Cavalry Officer of Eger castle in 1552, see Csiffáry 2003, 267 and 323–324. Stephano ZolthayIstván Zoltay was Cavalry Officer of Eger castle in 1552, see Csiffáry 2003, 347–350. et Martino KaldyMárton Káldy was pedestrian captain, see Szántó 1972, 201. capitaneis hic constitutis per litteras mandare, ut et ipsi conservationi arcis se tenere debeant, similiter et ad comitatus superiores litteras dare, ut illi quoque saluti eorum consulendum de maturo subsidio arcis providere curent.

[3.] Ego quantum proficere possum, de eo Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae in me nihil diffidat, verum (quod Deus avertat), si quid sinistri huic arci contigerit, protestor regiae maiestati et Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae non me, sed paucitatem hominum in ea existentem esse in causa. Ego propriori instructioni numerum trecentorum peditum complere curavi, ad conquerendumque pedites centum iam dimisi, pro eo Dominatio Vestra Reverendissima absque ulla mora dignetur super omnibus mihi citissimam facere relationem. Commisi adolescenti meo, ut si etiam equus ubi ad Vestram perveniet, Reverendissima Dominatio, illico morietur, cursu tamen celeri ad eandem Vestram Dominationem Reverendissimam festinare debeat, quod si fit, ut moreretur, dignetur Dominatio Vestra iterum equum alterum adolescenti meo dare, ut citissime redeat. Si etiam ille morietur loco illius quoque, Dominationi Vestrae Reverendissimae alterum dare sum paratus. Tantum est, ut Dominatio Vestra Reverendissima super omnibus mihi informationem citissimam dare dignetur. Restat, quod Dominationem Vestram Reverendissimam felicissime valere desidero.
Datum in arce Agriensi 12. Iunii anno Domini 1552.
Eiusdem Dominationis Vestrae Reverendissimae deditissimus servitor
